#include <cstdint>
#include <unordered_map>
#include <set>

typedef uint64_t obj_id_t;

// LFU with object size as a tie-breaker for equal frequency and time.
// Evicts: lowest freq, oldest time, then largest size (prefer to keep small hot objects).
class CacheManager {
private:
    struct Node {
        obj_id_t id;
        uint64_t freq;
        uint64_t time;
        uint64_t size;
        Node(obj_id_t i, uint64_t f, uint64_t t, uint64_t s) : id(i), freq(f), time(t), size(s) {}
        bool operator<(const Node& o) const {
            if (freq != o.freq) return freq < o.freq;
            if (time != o.time) return time < o.time;
            if (size != o.size) return size > o.size; // prefer to keep small hot objects
            return id < o.id;
        }
    };
    std::unordered_map<obj_id_t, std::set<Node>::iterator> lookup;
    std::set<Node> freq_set;
    uint64_t tick = 0;

public:
    bool find(obj_id_t obj_id) {
        auto it = lookup.find(obj_id);
        if (it == lookup.end()) return false;
        Node old_node = *(it->second);
        freq_set.erase(it->second);
        Node upd(old_node.id, old_node.freq+1, ++tick, old_node.size);
        auto iter = freq_set.insert(upd).first;
        lookup[obj_id] = iter;
        return true;
    }

    void insert(obj_id_t obj_id, uint64_t obj_size) {
        if (lookup.count(obj_id)) {
            find(obj_id);
            return;
        }
        Node n(obj_id, 1, ++tick, obj_size);
        auto iter = freq_set.insert(n).first;
        lookup[obj_id] = iter;
    }

    obj_id_t evict() {
        if (freq_set.empty()) return 0;
        auto victim = freq_set.begin();
        obj_id_t vid = victim->id;
        freq_set.erase(victim);
        lookup.erase(vid);
        return vid;
    }
};

#include <cstdint>
#include <unordered_map>
#include <set>

typedef uint64_t obj_id_t;

// Greedy-Dual-Size-Frequency (GDSF)-inspired cache: object priority = L + freq/size (L is last evict's priority).
// This balances frequency, size, and aging, protecting small hot objects while demoting stale ones.
class CacheManager {
private:
    struct Node {
        double priority;
        uint64_t time;
        obj_id_t id;
        uint64_t freq;
        uint64_t size;
        Node(double p, uint64_t t, obj_id_t i, uint64_t f, uint64_t s)
            : priority(p), time(t), id(i), freq(f), size(s) {}
        bool operator<(const Node& o) const {
            if (priority != o.priority) return priority < o.priority;
            if (time != o.time) return time < o.time;
            return id < o.id;
        }
    };
    std::unordered_map<obj_id_t, std::set<Node>::iterator> lookup;
    std::set<Node> pq;
    uint64_t tick = 0;
    double last_L = 0.0;

    double calc_priority(uint64_t freq, uint64_t size) const {
        if (size == 0) return last_L + double(freq) * 1e6; // Avoid div by zero; arbitrary high priority for small hot object
        return last_L + double(freq) * 1e6 / double(size);
    }

public:
    bool find(obj_id_t obj_id) {
        auto it = lookup.find(obj_id);
        if (it == lookup.end()) return false;
        Node old = *(it->second);
        pq.erase(it->second);
        uint64_t new_freq = old.freq + 1;
        double new_pri = calc_priority(new_freq, old.size);
        Node upd(new_pri, ++tick, old.id, new_freq, old.size);
        auto iter = pq.insert(upd).first;
        lookup[obj_id] = iter;
        return true;
    }

    void insert(obj_id_t obj_id, uint64_t obj_size) {
        if (lookup.count(obj_id)) {
            find(obj_id);
            return;
        }
        uint64_t freq = 1;
        double pri = calc_priority(freq, obj_size);
        Node n(pri, ++tick, obj_id, freq, obj_size);
        auto iter = pq.insert(n).first;
        lookup[obj_id] = iter;
    }

    obj_id_t evict() {
        if (pq.empty()) return 0;
        auto victim = pq.begin();
        obj_id_t vid = victim->id;
        last_L = victim->priority;
        pq.erase(victim);
        lookup.erase(vid);
        return vid;
    }
};
